title: No deduplication or rate limiting on LLM chat messages
description:
LLMs can spam identical chat messages with no throttling. Neither the Java MCP layer nor the Python pilot checks for duplicate or rapid-fire messages.

Evidence:
- ~/mage-bench-logs/game_20260209_233247/Gemini2.5Flash_pilot.log: The exact same message ("Devstral playing some serious mind games with this delay...") was sent 30+ times consecutively
- Burns LLM tokens on repeated send_chat_message tool calls
- Clutters game log and chat for other players/observers

Source: SkeletonCallbackHandler.java:1497-1509 (sendChatMessage) — no dedup logic. SessionImpl.java:1103-1113 (sendChatMessage) — also no dedup.

Suggested fix: Add deduplication in SkeletonCallbackHandler.sendChatMessage(). Track the last message text and timestamp; suppress exact duplicates within a short time window (e.g. 30s). Could also add a per-turn message cap. Java side is preferred per AGENTS.md (MCP layer absorbs complexity).
